channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Waymo's robotaxi fleet is being recalled again, this time for failing to stop for school buses
item.description: To prevent its robotaxi fleet from passing stopped school buses, Waymo is issuing another software recall in 2025. While it's not a traditional recall that pulls vehicles from the road, Waymo is voluntarily updating software for its autonomous fleet in response to an investigation from the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration. According to Waymo, the recall will be filed with the federal agency early next week. Mauricio Peña, Waymo's chief safety officer, said in a statement that Waymo sees far fewer crashes involving pedestrians than human drivers, but that the company knows when "o...

item.title: BYD dévoile son châssis révolutionnaire, la voiture aux 1 600 km d’autonomie et les Renault électriques avec moteur essence – Le récap’ Survoltés
item.description: Cette semaine, l’actualité de la mobilité a été particulièrement riche en innovations et en changements de cap majeurs. Entre la révolution industrielle signée BYD, le virage stratégique de Renault vers les prolongateurs d’autonomie, ou encore l’arrivée d’une station-service sans une goutte d’essence sur les routes françaises, les lignes bougent à toute vitesse. ...

item.title: How would the Netflix-Warner Bros. deal reshape Hollywood?
item.description: It’s only been a day since Netflix announced an $82.7 billion deal to acquire Warner Bros., and the acquisition has already been described as sending Hollywood into “full-blown panic mode,” “possibly a death blow to theatrical filmmaking,” and maybe even “the end of Hollywood” itself.

item.title: La version filaire de l’excellent Razer BlackShark V2 HyperSpeed est à moitié prix, un joli cadeau à glisser sous le sapin
item.description: Pour Noël, offrez un vrai cadeau à un gamer, comme ce casque Razer qui coche toutes les cases d’un son immersif, propre, compatible aussi bien consoles que PC. Et, quand son prix descend de 109,99 euros à 59,99 euros sur la Fnac, il devient presque impossible de dire non.

item.title: MacBook Air, MacBook Pro, Mac Mini… quels sont les meilleurs MacBook et Mac de bureau en 2025 ?
item.description: Il existe plusieurs gammes d'ordinateurs Apple : MacBook, iMac, Mac Studio. Vous ne savez pas quel Mac choisir ? On fait le point pour vous aider à choisir le meilleur MacBook (ou bien le Mac fixe) qui vous convient le mieux.

item.title: ‘There are really two elements that we looked to improve with this game’: we talk all things Nioh 3 with the game’s producers
item.description: TRG sits down with Team Ninja producers Kohei Shibata and Fumihiko Yasuda to discuss all things Nioh 3.

item.title: I needed a small NAS for my studio office, and the TerraMaster F2-425 NAS impressed me with size and power
item.description: The TerraMaster F2-425 is a two-bay NAS ideal for SMB and creatives looking for a fast and reliable backup and storage solution for the office or studio.

item.title: Samsung may have leaked the Galaxy S26 design through One UI 8.5 – and another Exynos 2600 rumor has emerged
item.description: We may now know more about what the Samsung Galaxy S26 phones look like, and how they'll be powered.

item.title: A New ‘Fallout’ Season 2 Clip Tries For a Speech Check
item.description: Looks like there's more of 'Fallout: New Vegas' in the show than just the titular town, including at least one other fan-favorite location.

item.title: Meta plans to push back the debut of its next mixed reality glasses to 2027
item.description: The big reveal for Meta's next mixed reality glasses is being postponed until the first half of 2027, according to a report from Business Insider. Based on an internal memo from Maher Saba, the vice president of Meta's Reality Labs Foundation, the report said that the company's project, which is codenamed "Phoenix," will no longer be scheduled for a 2026 debut. In a separate memo, Meta execs explained that the delay would help deliver a more "polished and reliable experience." According to BI, a memo from Meta's Gabriel Aul and Ryan Cairns said this new release window is "going to give us a lo...
